intro: Verbascum vandasii, commonly known as the Vanda's mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in Mediterranean climates. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
